text: I have been so lucky to be living here
for the last year my parents my brothers
and sisters I send them so many pictures
and they don't they don't believe it
because the me this house is place where
I used to see in a movie in an old
English movie the only reason that I I
left Syria and my my brother who's two
years older than me left was the
government army which we didn't want to
join we didn't want to hurt people we
didn't want to kill people
that's not us this is not what our
religion told us I was hoping to come
back in six months time so I was like
'mom I'm gonna see in six months time
but Here I am after seven years I didn't
see her I started my journey through
Turkey Greece the boat completes hora
and just just pure fear we ended up in
the Calais jungle the most horrendous
place that I've ever been in Europe
I got to the UK place for asylum I met
this really nice lady who helped me when
I was having trouble with accommodation
and I met with a chair trustee of this
house with sad sad house I have always
felt lucky in this place so mostly I
work in the garden think they say I have
green fingers green fingers right
I grow up in a very beautiful farmhouse
with my parents with you animals and I
used to help my mum in the gardens my
mum grow vegetables I think the first
thing I would show my mom is the garden
it's it's my favorite place in the whole
house
as you walk out or in the house you
always hear them in the morning
and I think you can hear them now
I feel lonely all the time my mom feels
that I'm living alone I don't have a lot
of connection with Syrians with friends
of mine but at the same time they feel
happy for me because I am very and they
know that I'm happy
wherever everybody plays the piano in
the house you can hear the music
everywhere it is my favorite object in
the house
[Music]
I always have this feeling of just not I
thought I'm not doing enough I'm not
doing enough for my for my community for
my people from my city for my country
but I am fighting the from war I'm
fighting for myself and I'm fighting for
my parents I fight for my family
a lot every single day every second of
my day there I bent the last seven years
away from them and so as so many Syrians
and I have so many friends of them
missed their families every single day
every second of their day really
[Music]
